intro: Cycloptychis marlothii, commonly known as the Marloth's cycloptychis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spiral-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
